DOC.HEAD: Names in the News
Eds: SUBS 3rd item to CORRECT character's name to `Keaton' sted `Keating.'
DOC.TEXT: Michael Gross has found life after ``Family Ties,'' although he was prepared to accept the relative obscurity that can follow the end of a hit TV series. ``I really did wonder for a while if I was going to disappear after the show went off the air,'' the actor said in a recent interview. ``But then I realized that there are two definitions of success: One is to be on a popular hit where everybody gets to see what you do, and the second is to just do good work, regardless of the size of the audience.'' Gross, who portrayed the father of Michael J. Fox's Alex Keaton in ``Family Ties,'' plays King Arthur in this week's NBC movie ``A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court.'' He also has a role as a survivalist in a science fiction film, ``Tremors,'' scheduled for release next month.
